title: Find cheaper groceries with these online resources

article.title: Find cheaper groceries with these online resources
article.description:
As prices climb, grocery shoppers are looking for more ways to save.Credit: Brian Kaiser / Bloomberg via Getty Images

Grocery prices [continue to rise for many Americans](https://www.nbcnews.com/data-graphics/grocery-price-tracker-inflation-trends-eggs-bread-trump-administration-rcna239569). Federal food assistance programs are pleading their case with a [hostile administration](https://www.cbpp.org/research/poverty-and-inequality/trump-administration-congressional-republicans-are-worsening). Food banks [across the country](https://www.reviewjournal.com/local/local-las-vegas/thousands-line-up-for-emergency-food-aid-in-las-vegas-amid-uncertainty-over-snap-benefits-3531439/) are trying to keep up.

Households, caught in the crosshairs of political and economic decisions by federal leaders, are trying to cut costs where they can and still feed themselves and their families balanced, whole meals.

How do they do that? Some strategic decision making, online deal hunting, and, as always, help from their communities.

**You May Also Like**

## Know your grocery stores

While the cost of groceries has increased across the board — soaring more than [29 percent since 2020](https://www.npr.org/2025/09/19/nx-s1-5539547/grocery-prices-tariffs-food-inflation) — prices and access still vary based on a shopper's location. States and counties may see their own price disparities, while households that shop in-person versus through [delivery services](https://mashable.com/article/instacart-is-ending-price-tests) are seeing a widening gap on receipts. Areas that have been left without major grocers, often referred to as [food deserts,](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2024/12/food-deserts-robinson-patman/680765/) have long faced inflated prices, only set to worsen.

Meanwhile, advocates like [New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani](https://newrepublic.com/article/193056/food-egg-prices-public-grocery-stores) are pushing for [more publicly-funded grocers](https://www.forbes.
